newsitem.title: USA: Visa says American Express to end pact.
newsitem.headline: Visa says American Express to end pact.

text.p: Visa U.S.A. said Thursday that American Express Co has agreed to terminate its joint "rewards accelerator" credit card program with Advanta Corp.

The settlement follows an agreement, reached April 17 by Visa and Advanta, in which Advanta agreed to terminate the card program. Visa said today's settlement calls for American Express to assist Advanta in closing out the program.
As part of the settlement, Visa said it and American Express agreed to dismiss all litigation stemming from the card program, which Visa believes was a violation of its trademark rights.
The awards accelerator card in dispute had enabled cardholders to earn "rewards points" tied to American Express' own rewards program.
"This agreement puts an end to that attempt to gain a free ride at the expense of Visa and its members," said Michael Beindorff, Visa's executive vice president for marketing and product management.
